review_title: one of the best small universities
pros: Great group of artists teaching the next generation
cons: wish the pay was better

review_title: Use to be a great place to work
pros: Benefits, beautiful and serene campus, new hires are hired at market rate
cons: Salaries of faculty is below market rate, employees are over worked and underpaid, too many additional time demands of faculty,

pros: Many friendly people are mission driven
cons: Talent is over-extended and underpaid

pros: Nice community. Faculty and Staff who care about students. Campus is very pretty on the outside. Need to work on some infrastructure like cleaning services.
cons: There are some negative employees (mostly great people though) and there is quite a bit of transition at this point.

pros: Great coworkers and welcoming environment.
cons: Just scheduling around classes can be difficult, but not that hard really.

pros: Friendly staff and helpful advisors. The library (where I worked) was well run and had a great culture.
cons: Limited hours depending on position. Which is totally understandable for work study.

review_title: Toxic environment and not enough pay
pros: Health insurance is cheap. EAP is also good.
cons: Not enough staff due to recent layoffs and people leaving. Overworked but no salary increase in years. They cut retirement during the pandemic but did restart it. Toxic work environment. Faculty look down on staff and staff dislike faculty.

pros: Tons of fluffy snow annually
cons: Blazing hot sun and no water

job_title: Student Technical Assistant in Westerville, OH
pros: Good hours, experience, and decent money.
cons: Dealing with some of the faculty can be hard.

job_title: Client Service Supervisor in Westerville, OH
pros: salary, work environment, empowerment, tone
cons: I haven't came across any cons at the job. The only part that doesn't agree with me is Otterbein's overly conservative values. However, this is not posed upon me, it is just the overall mood, which is still inviting none the less. I'm just an extreme left liberal, so we have some differing views on things, with mutual respect.

pros: Supported by management, well stocked supplies
cons: Uncertain of continuing employment from one year to the next.

pros: Great overall culture and people to work with.
cons: Athletics are not prioritized by school administration.

pros: Great family atmosphere for workers
cons: Large portfolios with minimal staff resulting in 60+ hrs each week

pros: Great co-workers.  People tend to stay working here a long time.  Good leadership.  Even though a small library, you have access to a much larger consortium (OHIOLink).  Student body growing more geographically diverse and better prepared.
cons: Pay is not great -- but that's usually the case at a small college.  Parking can be a pain.

pros: Great community ... low pressure job ... nice setting
cons: Not scholarly enough ... students feel entitled

pros: Small campus and so it is easy to know everyone that you are working with. This helps strengthen relationships among faculty and staff on campus, creating compassion to see each other succeed.
cons: Since it is a small campus it may be hard to find an opening in an department of interest right away.

job_title: MBA Research Assistant Graduate Assistant in Strongsville, OH
pros: Great people and school. School truly cares about student success and creating a community atmosphere. Flexible place to work
cons: Changes move slowly. There are a lot of people to go through to get simple tasks completed

pros: The people are passionate and care
cons: You will be over worked with not enough resources

pros: supportive, great people, tuition benefit, flexible schedule
cons: not much room to move up, pay is inflexible

pros: Wonderful students who work hard
cons: It's in white, Republican Westerville Ohio
